722470f-a.title: Manhattan: Park Terrace East - 217th Street (West)
722470f-a.text:
Park Terrece East, at the S.W. corner of West 217th (Park 'errace North )
Street.
June 26, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
The New York Sun of October 31, 1938, carries an article on the
real estate page (No. 35) reporting the demolition of this eighty year
old mansion and the sale of the entire block bounded by Park Terrace
East and Park Terrace West, W. 215th and 217th Streets. This plot con-
tains more than 118,000 square feet and will be improved by a group of
garden apartments designed by Albert Goldhammer and built by a group
headed by David Rose. Mr. Thomas DWyer, s prominent contractor, occupied
the mansion for more than a quarter of a centtry. His family were the
sellers.
